info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 10:47PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Wallace and Greeley Counties in west central Kansas through 1145 PM MDT... At 1047 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Cheyenne Wells to 7 miles northeast of Hartman. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weskan. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
